column4: can anyone tell me how to put up a external hard drive on nfs?
Is it a LAN connected drive with NFS support, or do you want to export an USB connected drive to NFS clients?
it is a usb drive connected to an nfs client
Please elaborate. Which machine is the drive usb cable connected to, and which machine needs access to it?
machine 192.168.1.3 is connected to it and machine 192.168.1.2 needs access to it.
both server and client on both
Then it's just to export it from the first and mount it on the second.
thats what im trying to do
what do you think im trying to do
Nothing special about USB drives, other than that it needs to be connected before the client attempts to mount..
on the server, add the drive to /etc/fstab (with a LABEL or UUID, not device name... USB device names is strange..) and /etc/exports
on the client, also add it to /etc/fstab but with a filesystem type of nfs, and device serveraddress:/mount/point (where it's mounted on the server)
